description.narrative: The SAMADANA/M strategic plan aims to create and establish a civil society structure in nine districts of Sri Lanka that actively engages in sustaining peace and contributing towards the peace building process. Despite the country has declared a military victory, the root causes are yet to be resolved. The Government has initiated various mechanisms – the national task force for transitional justice but productive decisions are so solutions are slow. From 2016-2018 the program is focusing on establishing a learning culture that promotes non-violence by developing modules and course material in peace building and conflict resolution. The efforts will also include engaging with civils society structures and participate in peace building processes while also supporting civils society networks in programming districts to contribute and engage with national reconciliation processes. Promotion of Samadana Ahimsa Societies and establishing a national network that will encourage and support non-violenct activists, and will spread the concepts of nonviolence to all districts, throughout the country. These societies will be registered as legal entities and strengthen the regional platforms. This in turn will support informal community reconciliation processes. The organisation is in the process of reviewing its strategic direction. SAMADANA/M envision that these civil society and community structures in the districts will activity contribute in sustainable peace building process in the country. This project falls under the conflict and justice global intervention area and will contribute towards the peace-building objective. The mainstreaming elements will include conflict sensitivity, gender equality and environment.
This project mainly contributes to results within Peace building. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
